Detailed Description

CTreeGraph.

Description: The CTreeGraph class is a container for the nodes in a tree graph. It provides complete and unsecured access to its attributes. The CTreeGraph also encapsulates its own file I/O for both saving and loading. For image output of the tree layout see the CTreeGraphRenderer.

Limitations: Direct use of this class can be very dangerous. It is recommended that this class be placed inside a CTreeGraphModel before interacting with it.

CTreeGraph::~CTreeGraph (   ) 
 

CTreeGraph::~CTreeGraph.

Description: This is the destructor which frees up dynamic memory used by the class. Only the start node must be deleted because the destructor of the nodes will delete the associated child nodes.

Precondition:
None
Postcondition:
None
Limitations: None

void CTreeGraph::loadHelper (  STreeNode *  node,
QDataStream &  stream
) 
 

CTreeGraph::loadHelper.

Description: This function loads a single node from the given data stream and then recursively calls itself to load the tree depth first.

Precondition:
None
Postcondition:
The given node is loaded along with all its children.
Parameters:
node,: This is a pointer to the node in which to load the data to.
stream,: This is a reference to the data stream which contains the node's data which needs to be loaded.
Limitations: None
